availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Juett (Ballard County, Kentucky, saddler and postmaster)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, saddler and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Emily Juett. Father of Mary A. Juett White. Saddler in Blandville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Saddler in Blandville in 1860. Postmaster at Blandville from May 2, 1863, to October 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 276B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 12.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 565.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Carlisle County Wills, vol. 1, 1886-1927, p. 73.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Ballard County, Kentucky, vol. 28.
"Thomas J. Juett (1809-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #31143174, accessed August 18, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31143174.
